info.title: Role
info.content: Project management, visual design, web development

info.title: Development Tools
info.content: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js (Express + Handlebars), SQLite

blocks.title: Objective
blocks.content: Design and develop a web application to help aid staff members of the Center for Community Health (CCH) under the UCSD School of Medicene.

blocks.title: Mission Statement
blocks.caption: The Live Well Community Market Program aims to improve and promote access to healthy foods throughout San Diego County by working with neighborhood markets to increase the availability of fresh and healthy products, redesign markets to promote healthy foods, and connect with community stakeholders to build a healthier food environment for all San Diego residents.

blocks.title: Work In Progress
blocks.caption: Brought together by the UC San Diego course, ENG100D - Design for Development, our team is diligently working on the development of this project. Stay tuned for more details!

info.title: Development Tools
info.content: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, API Linking

blocks.title: Objective
blocks.content: Develop a full-stack application focusing on interacting with real world data.

blocks.title: Work In Progress
blocks.caption: Brought together by the UC San Diego course, ENG100D - Design for Development, our team is diligently working on the development of this project. Stay tuned for more details!

blocks.title: Objective
blocks.content: Design and develop a mobile web application focused on the principles of interaction design.

blocks.title: The Quantified Self
blocks.content: With the help of digital devices, we have an unprecedented ability to track our behaviors, habits, and thoughts. But turning data about ourselves and our communities into valuable insights is still remarkably difficult. My studio explored ways to support monitoring, reflection, and behavior change by collecting, consuming, and sharing personally relevant information. We considered how might we help people learn more about their everyday lives through self-tracking, and how might we help people draw insights from the mass of data they collect about themselves.

blocks.title: Who is Our Audience?
blocks.content: This section is currently under construction, check back later for updates!

blocks.title: Final Touches
blocks.content: Come check out the live prototype here!

info.title: Roles
info.content: Fully contributed to web design and development.

info.title: Skills
info.content: Visual design, UI design, front-end and back-end development, branding

sections.content: To showcase my adaptive skillset by designing and developing my personal website portfolio.

sections.title: Dark Design
sections.content: I have always had an afinity towards dark-themed designs. While they are capable of elegance and sophistication, dark designs can also be edgy and striking. I took inspiration from magazine spreads that I thought are bold yet balanced.

sections.title: Hearing Color
sections.content: An album's artwork is an extension of the music itself. It enhances the listener's experience by complementing the mood the artist is conveying. These are some albums that I appreciate for both their music and their aesthetics, and that inspired me to play with color palettes surrounding dark design.

In order to hone my web development skills, I challenged myself to build my portfolio from the ground up. Utilizing my knowledge of HTML, CSS and Javascript, I aimed to complete a sleek platform to showcase my work. My education at University of California, San Diego has allowed me to keep expanding my development arsenal by introducing tools that I can incorporate into my portfolio, such as Node.js (Express + Handlebars).
